mdRecord.dcterms:title: East Range, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas (American statesman, architect, and draftsman, 1743-1826) [architect]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Looking north up the arcade past Hotel D entrance door

The Range is part of the original grounds of the University of Virginia as designed by Thomas Jefferson in Charlottesville, Virginia, USA. The Range buildings run parallel to and face away from the Lawn, and are separated from the Lawn by a series of ten gardens (five per side). There are six "hotels" on the Range, three on each side. Originally used as dining facilities, the hotels today include a number of administrative office spaces as well as the Jefferson Literary and Debating Society. - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Range [work]
